login.title: Login
login.confirmCode: Make sure you this is the correct access code.
login.disclaimer: Please be aware that your access code will be written to a public blockchain.
login.pleasewaitDescription: Your registration has been sent to the administrator. As soon as the administrator accredits you, you can join the assembly.
login.notesBrowserDescription: You must complete your assembly with your current browser and device. Do not clear cache during an assembly.
login.notesSecurityDescription: Do not access with with multiple codes or with codes from other people. Otherwise you might be locked out.
login.noteVideo: Video Conference is an experimental feature. Video is hosted and served by https://meet.jit.si. The video call is not protected.
login.testVideoDescription: In case you want to use the video functionality, please test it here in order to make sure it works well on your device or browser.
login.RegisterFailed: Registration failed. Please try again or contact support.
login.Play: Play a game in the meantime...

assemblyStart.title: Overview
assemblyStart.finishDescription: Click this button to go to the closure page with a summary of your votes.
assemblyStart.VoteFail: Voting failed. Please try again or contact support.

main.title: CryptoChefs
main.aboutDescription: CryptoChefs is a blockchain based voting tool for annual general meetings (AGM) and other types of assemblies. All polling is stored on the Ethereum blockchain.
main.joinAssemblyQRBody: Use this function if you got a QR code.
main.eventCodeHelper: If you were provided with a code (starting with 0x...), enter here

assemblynew.title: Create new assembly
assemblynew.fieldIdentifierHelp: Please note that this information will be written to the blockchain.
assemblynew.Name: Name your assembly
assemblynew.waitDescription: Wait while your assembly is being created on the blockchain.
assemblynew.Creating: Creating new assembly. Please wait while the blockchain confirmation takes place.
assemblynew.CreatingFailed: Creating assembly failed. Please try again or contact support.
assemblynew.Success: You successfully created an assembly. The blockchain address is
assemblynew.GoAdminpanel: Let's go to the admin panel
assemblynew.VoteCast: Thanks for casting your vote. Please wait while the blockchain confirmation takes place.

admin.adminOnly: This can be access only by the administrator of this assembly.

explainer.q1: Why are results written to the blockchain?
explainer.a1: The blockchain is a secure and immutable data record.
explainer.q2: The blockchain is public, so is everything I do on Voveo public?
explainer.a2: Basically yes. This means you should be careful of what you do with Voveo. However, as long as you do not share any personal information, you are pseudonymous - there is a track record of your account, but no one knows which person this account belongs to.
explainer.a3: The administrator hands out a personalized access code that you should not share with anybody.
explainer.q4: How can I revert/undo my vote/choice?
explainer.a4: You can't. That is why there is a confirmation. You may of course ask the administrator to invalidate the ballot and to repeat the vote.
explainer.a5: When using Voveo, a private and public key is being generated in the background. This is your gateway to use the blockchain.
explainer.a6: Voveo runs on Ethereum and is connected to the Ethereum mainnet. However, we provide access to other Ethereum-based blockchain, e.g. Ropsten testnet, PoA or your custom blockchain
explainer.q7: Voting should be confidential. Can anyone see what I voted for?
explainer.a7: Your vote is treated confidentially. The blockchain records a) who has voted and b) how many yes/no-votes are cast - there is no record of what you have voted for.
explainer.q8: What are these cryptic strings, e.g. 0x08dc456423e683eC2135640ba77b465197D9D212?
explainer.a8: Since everything runs on the blockchain, we use smart contracts. Every smart contracts has such an identifier. Your public key too is such a string. Don't worry, there is no need for you to remember or write down these strings.

assemblyEnd.title: Closure
assemblyEnd.subtitle: For your personal record, feel free to print this page summarizing your votes.
assemblyEnd.closeBrowser: You may now close this window.

wallet.title: Your Account
wallet.exportTooltip: Careful: Anyone who has access to your private key can access your account. Do export your key only to save it as a backup in a secure environment.
wallet.exportQRTooltip: Careful: Do not show this QR code to anyone. Use this only to import your private key in another device, e.g. your smart phone.
wallet.exportQRExposeConfirm: By confirming, you expose your private key.
wallet.exportPKmsgDescription: By confirming, you download your private key.
wallet.importDescription: Careful: Importing an existing private key will overwrite your current key and account.
wallet.importScanQRDescription: Careful: Importing an existing private key will overwrite your current key and account.
wallet.importConfirmDescription: By confirming, you activate the new key. Are you sure this is the correct key:
wallet.setPasswordDescription: Set a password to protect your private key.
wallet.WalletConnectDescription: Connect a wallet from an external provider.
wallet.PersistentStorageDescription: With persistent storage enabled, your data will not be swiped when you clear your browsers data. Learn more here: https://web.dev/persistent-storage/
